intro: Cacalia nokoensis, commonly known as the Noko's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically blue or purple, forming small, clustered inflorescences that bloom in spring. Cacalia nokoensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
